questions.question: The rate of motion of charges in a conductor:

The magnitude of drift velocity is:
Which of the following is a correct statement:
options: A) The ratio of the potential difference applied across conductor to current produced measures resistance.
B) Drift velocity in free electrons is really responsible for the generation of current.
C) The direction of current from positive to the negative terminal of the battery is referred to as conventional current.

questions.question: For electronic current:
questions.correct_answer: B) Charge flows from negative to positive terminal of the battery.
options: A) Charge flows from positive to negative terminal.
B) Charge flows from negative to positive terminal of the battery.
C) Charge flows in both positive and negative directions.

questions.correct_answer: A) Internal resistance equal to external resistance

B) Internal resistance is greater than external resistance
C) Internal resistance is less than external resistance

questions.question: 100 watt and 200 watt electric bulbs operated through 20 volts and 40 volts, then the resistance is:
To draw the maximum current from a combination of cells, how should the cells be grouped:
options: D) Depends upon the relative values of external and internal resistance

questions.question: The equivalent resistance of resistors connected in series is always:
questions.correct_answer: D) Equal to the sum of component resistors
options: A) Equal to the mean of component resistors
B) Less than the lowest of component resistors
C) In between the lowest and the highest of component resistors
D) Equal to the sum of component resistors

questions.question: The length of a conductor is halved. Its conductance will be:
When cells are connected in series:
When cells are connected in series:
Three resistances 5000, 500, and 50 ohms are connected in series across 555 volts mains. The current flowing through them will be:
In a house circuit, all the electrical appliances are connected in parallel to each other between the line and neutral wires to get:
questions.correct_answer: B) Same current and potential difference
options: B) Same current and potential difference
C) Different current but same potential difference
D) Different currents and potential differences

questions.question: Why should a resistance be introduced in a circuit in series deliberately:
Why should different resistances be added in series in a circuit:
When the resistors are connected less in parallel, the equivalent resistance is always:
questions.correct_answer: B) Greater than the smallest resistance in the combination.
options: A) Greater than the sum of the individual resistances.
B) Greater than the smallest resistance in the combination.
C) Equal to the sum of the individual resistances.
D) Less than the smallest resistance in the combination.

questions.question: When the resistors are connected greater in series, the equivalent resistance is always:
questions.correct_answer: C) Less than the largest resistance in series.
options: A) Greater than the greatest resistance in series
B) Equal to the greatest resistance in series.
C) Less than the largest resistance in series.
D) Less than the smallest resistance in series.

questions.question: Power dissipated as heat in the conductor of resistance 'R' due to electric current 'I' is given by:

questions.correct_answer: B) Same current and potential difference
options: B) Same current and potential difference
C) Different currents but same potential difference.
D) Different currents and potential differences.
